Dialogue: No. Not the same! You've only known Akasha dormant. She too will find you. She is choosing her moment. She has come to destroy you, Lestat. And in her wrath, she will devour everything that moves. Mortal and vampire alike.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Well then, it's every vampire for himself. Just the kind of rules I like. The rules you taught me.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Do you remember your first words to me, Marius? 'I am unknowable.'  I'd rather not exist at all than have to live eternally as a ghost.

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: And you're taking everyone with you, you fool! We were once mortals, too. It is our heritage we protect!

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Such reverence for mortals! Then you should have left me as one!

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: You're a monster.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Said the vampire to his son.

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: Hello...

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: Hmmm... his scent is fading.     He was here too long ago...

Speaker: vampire lover
Dialogue: You like him, love?

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: He reminds me of someone I know.

Speaker: vampire lover
Dialogue: All he's gonna remind you of soon is a pile of bones. We're gonna dismember him. Bleed him dry.

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: Really? Is that what you're going to do?

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: Then again, you could always do this...

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: Turn up the music!

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: Oh, I do love the 21st Century.

Speaker: mael
Dialogue: Marius, you've broken your oath. You were to watch over Akasha and Khayman. You are a great disappointment to me.

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Pandora, Armand, it's been a long time. Khayman, Maharet, to what do I owe this honor?

Speaker: khayman
Dialogue: You have been summoned because of your errant child...

Speaker: pandora
Dialogue: He's quite the devil, isn't he?

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: His music mocks us, Pandora!

Speaker: pandora
Dialogue: His music moves my blood.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: Keep your amorous thoughts to yourself. His music is a threat to all vampires. We will let the covens dismember him at his concert.

Speaker: mael
Dialogue: Yes.   It will set an example.

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: I don't see how this solves things. This isn't thought through.

Speaker: khayman
Dialogue: Marius, we understand your affection for Lestat, but your duty is to us!

Speaker: khayman
Dialogue: We could always get rid of him right now.

Speaker: mael
Dialogue: No. We will contact the covens. Let them know we condone the slaying. It will be better for all to see.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: Wait. Never mind Lestat!   We have greater problems...

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Maharet is right. It is Akasha we face now.

Speaker: pandora
Dialogue: Is it true, Maharet?   Has our Queen really risen!

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: Don't be so happy, Pandora. I knew Akasha when she walked this earth. I was her slave. I am now her enemy. I know what she is capable of.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: Yes. We've all felt her presence, even as she hides from us.  What does she want now?

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: She knows only one thing. Taking pleasure in destroying life. She is already killing the young ones to build her strength.

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: She's sucked the life out of her King like a praying mantis. I sense she is getting closer.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: She has come to destroy Lestat, but he will only whet her thirst more...

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: If we act together, we have a chance to destroy her.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: Yes! We must destroy her immediately! If she is not stopped, I'm afraid of what will happen to the entire mortal world.

Speaker: mael
Dialogue: But can she be destroyed? I am left to bear the scars of the last attempt on her life. She was dragged into the sun. She survived. But we almost didn't...

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: What happens to our Queen happens to us. If Akasha dies, we die as well.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: Then so be it! We must take that chance.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: We must destroy Akasha. For the sake of humanity! We must find her. Now!

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: But perhaps she has come to kill Lestat and then will go back to her slumber. That is our only hope.

Speaker: pandora
Dialogue: Yes. That's right. She and the covens will take care of that brat. We must go to the concert and pay our respects to our great Queen.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: How? With your own throat! You've all been asleep too long! You're still dreaming.

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Maharet speaks the truth.   It is our only hope.

Speaker: mael
Dialogue: No. Armand is right. We will go to the concert and first see what she does. There may be no need for action.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: Then you go to the concert and you shall see!  And I thought the Ancients became wise with their years.

Speaker: roger's pov
Dialogue: A Goth girl on the street in front of a record store.

Speaker: jesse's pov
Dialogue: Roger's back is TO us as he talks to a Goth girl in a whisper.

Speaker: roger
Dialogue: The... girls you asked for, Lestat. They're here, in the guest wing.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Ah.   Yes.

Speaker: roger
Dialogue: I was uh... just gonna go catch a movie at the Chinese. I don't suppose you'd all want to...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: No, thank you, Roger.   We'll entertain ourselves.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Perhaps you would like a tour of the place... first.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Roger... would you be so kind?

Speaker: roger
Dialogue: Sure. Right this way, girls.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Roger. Not that one.   Leave her to me...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You must be very keen to die.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: The Talamascans have become quite stealthy. I didn't know infiltration was quite their style.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: It's not. I... I came on my own.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: How did you find me?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I've been tracking your manager for days...  Then I figured out you simply have to look the part.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Clever librarian... You should know, based on all your research, that groupies don't ever find their way out of here again.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I'm not a groupie...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Then why are you following me? What do you want?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Are you granting wishes?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Last wishes. What's yours?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Show me what it's like to be you. That's my last wish. Grant it, Lestat.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: I don't have time for this.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: All a vampire has is time.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Maybe not.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I understand why you're doing it. You have to be who you are, no matter what happens.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: But how are you spending what may be your last night on Earth, Lestat? As you always have... Alone.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Don't kill me yet. Let's spend our last nights together. Share it with me.   Show me what it's like to be you.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You don't know what you're asking! I don't know what's in that librarian's head of yours, but it's not what you think.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: That's right. You don't know what's in my head, Lestat. Do you want to?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: I'll know when I kill you.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Gee, Lestat, that's a great way to get to know someone. Here. I'll give you a preview. Coming attractions. This is what you'll find.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I have this recurring dream that I'm a child and I'm living in this big house filled with vampires. And every night when I go to sleep, I wish to God the same thing... you know what that is, Lestat?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: That I will have the dream again... Because in the dream I'm happy. And the dream is more real than my life... I don't know how, but I know you, Lestat... My life is a big mystery and you, you have the answer...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I can't go on pretending this life of mine is real. I can't live a lie... I'm just like you Lestat. We're the same...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Are we? I seek the light.     You seek the shadows.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: No. We're looking for exactly the same thing. You know it... Please. Show me.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Alright!

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: This may be painful for a mortal. You're still attached to your skin.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I don't care.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Close your eyes.    Don't breathe.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Do that again!

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: And now for my next trick.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Did it hurt?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Yes. For just a moment. But as the pain is more intense for us, so is ecstacy.  You see, we love our victims.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Love?    I thought it was the blood.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: No, although the taste is so rich and sweet. Love is the essence of the dark gift. The connection is so much more satisfying, brief as it is, than anything else.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: As you drink, you feel the heart weakening... it struggles even though there's no hope. You feel the life slipping away, the flash of those brief years. The taste of mortality you can no longer experience... and it is beautiful...  No 'relationship,' no commingling can ever reach the heights of that experience.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Your blood...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Do you like it?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Yes...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Do it to me... Please... With your blood I'll know you...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I'll know everything...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You want to know everything. You want to see what it's like. Then come! I'll show you.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Is she alright?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Come closer, Jesse. You want to see? You want to know?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Lestat, no!

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You see now? Are you ready?     Now do you want it?!

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: No.   Of course you don't.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Well I didn't grant your final wish.  It was an impossible wish to begin with. You see, I am unknowable.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Lestat!    Wait!

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Good-bye, Talamascan.

Speaker: young jesse
Dialogue: Why can't I stay with you?! Please, Auntie Maharet!

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: I don't want you to go, but you must.

Speaker: young jesse
Dialogue: Auntie, you're bleeding...

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: You must be with your own, my sweetest girl. I'll always be watching over you.

Speaker: young jesse
Dialogue: I want to stay with you forever.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: Forever is a very long time.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: Hello, my princess.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Aunt Maharet?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: You're a...?

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: Yes. Oh, Jesse, I've missed you so much, but I had to keep this from you.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Oh my God, this is why... I knew I was different. I knew --

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: Come...

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: You are the most precious of my great family...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Am I...?

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: No. You are not. I was once mortal, too. My sister died before her child was one year old. I took care of that child, and her children, and her children's children...

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: This is our family -- my way of coping with eternity. The labyrinth of life. The family teaches me the rhythms and passions of each age.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: You are my most prized light. You are what keeps me connected to the world of the living.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: When your parents died I took you to India to take care of you.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: And something happened there.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: I stopped it from happening.    And I will again.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: Jesse, you must stay away from Lestat. You must forget all about him.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: Yes, I know about your new friend. You think you love him, but it's not as you thought it would be.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I thought I was like him.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: I know, but it is not who you are, not who you are meant to be. You have found that out now.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Lestat's all I can think about... I felt like I belonged with him. Now I know why...

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: Jesse, you must forget about him. You must trust me...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I missed you so much, Aunt Maharet.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: Me too.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: You will go home to London in the morning.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: But this is my home. This is where I belong. Why do you want to get rid of me so quickly?

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: Now is not the time to be here...

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: You were seeking answers. Now you have found them. The family is who you are.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: You will go home to London tomorrow.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Jesse.

Speaker: vampire driver
Dialogue: Need a ride?

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Hello, David.

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: I must show you my new paintings sometime.

Speaker: pandora
Dialogue: It's just like Nero's day.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: Akasha will not be able to resist this...

Speaker: roger
Dialogue: They're getting pretty worked up out there.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Come on, children.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: I'm so glad I decided to rise...  After tonight, Death Valley will live up to its name!

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You want more?!

Speaker: crowd
Dialogue: Yes!

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: This one's for those who've come for me!

Speaker: pandora
Dialogue: There are too many of them! They're going to dismember him.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: Good!

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Get out of here!

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Lestat!    Lestat!

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Akasha.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: She is here...

Speaker: fire marshal
Dialogue: You don't have a permit for any of these stunts!

Speaker: roger
Dialogue: I told you I don't know anything about it!

Speaker: roger
Dialogue: Last time I work for a bloody vampire...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Lestat!    Lestat!

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Akasha...

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: Why so surprised, my love?    You called, and I have come.

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: Never fear me, Lestat. Your wishes have all come true.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: My wishes...?

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: You have yearned for a companion to share eternity. You have cried out to the world. I have answered your call.

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: You are so bold, like your music. It woke me. You live your life in the open, like I did long ago, when I had a King.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Had a King?

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: He's no more. You are my consort. I've kept you safe -- alive.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You?

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: You thought it was all you?  You have the ego of a king as well. I know you, Lestat. I know that you crave to have the world at your feet. I have come to give it to you.

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: Has your tongue lost its taste for blood?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Never.

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: But you didn't kill the mortal girl.

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: Instead you kissed her.   Now kiss me.

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: Be my King. Forget about everything else.

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: What's your answer?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Can we try that again?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Show me the world...

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: We see now what Akasha means to do. Rule as Queen again.  This is why we must fight Akasha!

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: For the sake of all mortals. She must be stopped, or the mortal world will end.

Speaker: mael
Dialogue: But is there a way?   We don't know.

Speaker: khayman
Dialogue: When she opens herself to give her blood, she is vulnerable.

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Then we weaken her. Drain her of almost all her blood, but leave her just one drop.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: We can't take that chance.    We must finish her.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: If she dies, we all die.

Speaker: pandora
Dialogue: We're damned no matter what happens.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: Perhaps.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: And what about Lestat?

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: Lestat has joined with Akasha. He is lost to us now. He is never coming back.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I don't believe that.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Where are we?

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: We are home.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You live here?

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: We live everywhere and anywhere we choose. The world is our garden.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: So warm...  ... their blood...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: ... they're mortal...

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: ... of course. They serve the living goddess, and her consort. They find you beautiful. You are a god in their eyes.

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: Behold our Kingdom.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: Why not?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: This is the reason you have risen?

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: They believed in nothing, now they are nothing. But you and I will change all that. We will give the world something to believe in again.

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: Come, my King.      We have a score to settle.

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: She comes...

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: My children. It warms my blood to see you all gathered... plotting against me.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: Akasha.

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: Maharet. You will address my King first...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Lestat!

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: What has she done to you?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Made me see.

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Lestat... step aside.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Never.    She is my Queen.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: Akasha. The world has changed since you reigned.

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: Then we shall change it back. Humans are animals, brute creatures. Their destruction can only make sense.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: We've found other ways to co- exist.

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: Yes. In the shadows. In silence. In shame. For what? For respect of mortals? They are nothing to us. They are only... food.

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: Poor Maharet. Still trying to hold onto what I took from you.

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: Akasha, please...

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: You think you can change my will? I'm tired of this discussion. Join me, or die.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: I will not.

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: I will not.

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: I want to hear it from every one of you. What will it be?

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: Don't tell me, you have feelings for these ridiculous mortals!

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: Do you love me?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Yes...

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: Prove it. Kill her.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: She's nothing to me.

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: Just the same, I'd like you to kill her. For me.  I've had enough of this 'great family.' It's time to end it.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: You will not touch her!

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: You still think to challenge me, Maharet?

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: I beg you, spare this child.

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: Now.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: It's all right, Maharet.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: It's what I want.   I am ready.

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: How sweet...

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: Good-bye, great family.

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: Now, my children, remember your real family! Or else.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: But, My Queen, you've forgotten my reward!

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: That's right. My King, you've just earned your crown.

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: You see how he obeys.    You will or you will all die!

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: That's enough, Lestat.

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: Lestat.    Enough.   Stop!

Speaker: akasha
Dialogue: You kill me, you kill yourselves.

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: Wait, Lestat! You must stop!

Speaker: khayman
Dialogue: We survived!

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: I left you one drop, my love. Drink deep and live.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I thought I'd lost you...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Drink, my love.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: I will never leave you again.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Maharet...

Speaker: maharet
Dialogue: My child, let me look at you... You are finally happy. It is as it should be now... I will watch over you always.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: She took Akasha's last drop, took Akasha's death into herself. Behold, our Queen... our new mother...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Is she... dead?

Speaker: khayman
Dialogue: No, she will live forever. She sleeps. She sleeps, and dreams of us.

Speaker: marius
Dialogue: My Queen, I will watch over you always.

Speaker: talbot
Dialogue: Jesse.     My God...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: David, this is Lestat.

Speaker: talbot
Dialogue: How do you do?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Charmed, I'm sure.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: I told you I'd return with my findings. Here they are.

Speaker: talbot
Dialogue: But please, sit down. You'll have to excuse me... it's just so... so...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Unexpected?

Speaker: talbot
Dialogue: Strangely, no...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Please don't be sad. I'm where I belong. I'm happy now.

Speaker: talbot
Dialogue: Excuse me for asking but...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: What's it like?

Speaker: talbot
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Do you want to find out?

Speaker: talbot
Dialogue: Me?... No. I'm too old to live forever.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Well, if you ever should change your mind... Oh. I have a present for you. From an old friend.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: And Marius sent a message. You were right. He doesn't go to the Dorchester. But he's gonna be at Claridge's later...

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Well, I guess this is good-bye.

Speaker: talbot
Dialogue: Yes.   Take care of her, Lestat.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Always.

Speaker: talbot
Dialogue: Good-bye, Jesse.

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: Good-bye, dear friend.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Shall we go get a drink, love?
